EPIC Career was founded to help individuals fully understand and optimize their talents for a lifetime of academic and career success. Offering convenient online administration of two well-researched psychological assessments and convenient webcam or in-person consultations, we:1) help individuals focus on a career choice that has high likelihood of long-term career satisfaction2) help parents understand their child's unique personality strengths and weaknesses toward strengthening parent/child relationships and building optimal learning strategies for students3) help workers better understand their unique contributions to their work teams.
Creating innovative curricula that are helping students develop career focus and learn strategies toward making the most of their college investment.
Creating innovative curricula that are helping students develop career focus and learn strategies toward making the most of their college investment.
Taught career focus strategies to graduating seniors.

recommendations: Andrew Weatherford
Lighting Design Specialist
September 11, 2015, Andrew was a client of Dr. Steven’s

For several years, I have drifted aimlessly in my professional career feeling my true talents and potential had not been realized.  I fell victim to the same rut most everyone I know falls in …staying in a profession they are not too happy with but ‘it pays the bills’.  Unsure what to really expect, my experience with Dr. Rodriguez was not only eye opening but inspirational.  There are not too many people in my world who I can truly say ‘He really impresses me’, but Dr. Rodriguez’s assessment process was able to congeal my ‘jack of all trades’ approach and pin point a solution to satisfy both my personal and professional ambitions.  I am able to focus now on where I want to be and how to get there…Don’t be afraid to let Dr. Rodriguez to guide your drifting career!

Steven is easy to talk to, very resourceful and able to find those gold nuggets hidden deep in one's psyche. It was a genuine pleasure working with him again and I highly recommend him.

Builder Service Rep at Metallic Building Company
December 16, 2014, Tim was a client of Dr. Steven’s

I have known Dr. Steven since long before he created EPIC Career. His approach has guided many people in the right direction to fulfilling careers. However, since I already knew my Myers-Briggs personality type and have been happy with my career I was not sure if his services would be helpful to me.I learned the time and cost involved is minimal compared to the one-on-one interaction and very specific knowledge provided. It was quite revealing for me to see how my personality type influences the way I react, make decisions and interact with others. I now have greater understanding about common sources of conflict with other personality types (You J’s are an enigma to me). I also have insight on how to leverage those traits in the business world as well as my private life.Unless you are perfectly happy in your career and have no personality conflicts to deal with, you owe it to yourself to make the small investment in time and money to learn more about yourself.

April 30, 2014, Betty was a client of Dr. Steven’s

I highly recommend Dr. Steven Rodriguez for his work in EPIC Career.  My 17 year old granddaughter took his assessments and met with him for results analysis.  What came out of this exercise was a young person whose feelings were validated, a mother who understood her daughter so much more, and both feeling with her personality, she is "going to be so successful that none of us have to worry anymore!”  What a gift Dr. Rodriguez gave my family.  We are all confident that our college bound senior will be successful next year, and she will have a positive experience with the road map Steven provided to careers that work with her interests and personality. If you need a new direction, or validation that you are on the right path to your future, I strongly recommend Dr. Rodriguez and Epic Career.  It will be the best investment you ever make.Betty Williams										                        Founder and Executive Director									                   San Antonio Country Day Montessori School							                   San Antonio, TX

April 16, 2014, Dr. Steven was senior to Jon but didn’t manage directly

It was because of a change in leadership at the Houston campus of Our Lady of the Lake University that I had the opportunity to Meet Dr. Rodriguez. The leadership change came unexpectedly and I found that I again needed to reach out and accept this change. I am glad that I saw the need to developed a working relationship with Dr. Rodriguez. My educational needs were met through the efforts and work of Dr. Rodriguez. In Dr. Rodriquez I see a person who is committed to providing for the needs of others thru service. I have found Dr. Rodriguez as being reliable, honest, I have seen him show deep respect, not only to other people but to those he might not agree with. Dr. Rodriguez in his role as Director at the Houston Campus has a great deal of influence on all of us who were affiliated in some way to the University. As a campus administrator I observed Dr. Rodriguez enhance teamwork observed Dr. Rodriguez managing a busy office, enhance teamwork encourage collaboration while he treated all fairly. was fair to all. aware of the his natural demeanor and fairness. Dr. Rodriguez led by example which allowed him to set the bar high.

Working with Steve has been a game changer for me.  Steve is so exceptionally knowledgeable about personality and how my personality type affects the way that I work. Armed with a new insight into my strengths, I’m excited to see how far I can go.   I can’t recommend Steve highly enough for his career guidance and wisdom.

March 31, 2014, Peter reported directly to Dr. Steven

Steven is an unflappable, confident, resourceful leader in education.  During the time I worked for him at Belhaven, Steven was instrumental in helping me adapt to the institutional culture, and was an effective advocate to the college's administration for incremental changes while also finding ways for faculty to adjust their methods and expectations without wavering in their commitment to a high standard of instruction.  Steven always seems happiest in his work when he is listening, understanding, and advising; he has worked hard to find roles that suit his skills, and should definitely be able to help others seek similar joy in life.

Without hesitation, I offer high recommendation of Adrian Lopez. As a student in my Career Development course at DeVry University, Adrian exhibited excellent professional communication, and high level critical thinking/reasoning skills. His IT and leadership expertise was obvious by his thoughtful, well-considered, appropriately delivered comments in class. Always punctual, he was an active participant in class activities and showed maturity handling group, individual, and online assignment demands. I think of him as a knowledgeable, thoughtful IT professional with uniquely effective interpersonal communication and leadership skills. He would make a great asset to any leadership team. I highly recommend him.

Dr. Fraga-Kingsbury is a passionate, highly knowledgeable administrator, advisor and collegiate instructor in higher education. I worked with her as a faculty colleague at San Antonio College. We both taught First-Year Experience courses and participated in curriculum planning meetings in the development of a new course. Not only did I find Mary to be friendly, thoughtful and kind interpersonally, I found that she had developed a broad expertise about higher education that she generously offered her students. I highly recommend her for administrative, advising and faculty positions and would look forward to working alongside her in the future.

summary: Career Consultant, Corporate Trainer, and Higher Education Leader with a track record of successfully helping individuals and groups optimize their talents for work-life and personal success. As a senior university administrator, I led accreditation compliance, assessment, and program development efforts in addition to overall campus Academic and Student Affairs processes that led to enrollment growth.
